author: danielknopik
content:
now libp2p can't connect due to this: https://docs.rs/libp2p/latest/libp2p/core/upgrade/enum.NegotiationError.html#variant.Failed
we suppose you didnt do anything special with libp2p protocol negotiation?

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> The fork digest, computed from configuration and genesis state, is part of the protocol id used in negotiation and exchange of messages. Looking at previous configuration issues, thatâ€™s likely the problem here

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
```
Sep 18 08:40:32.283 DEBG Handshake Failure                       reason: Incompatible forks Ours:02328408 Theirs:9c671128, peer: 16Uiu2HAmBQRRuf7dZYgoXDcafzdyGzsrA5Gtbet6gyP4r3w7zfkv
```

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> The forkdigest is a mix of fork version, and genesis validator set hash tree root

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> Probably just need to correct the fork versions in config or change the fork epoch numbers so the node uses the right one

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: > cfg.Eip4844ForkVersion = []byte{0x83, 0x00, 0x0f, 0xfd}

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: it's 83 not 03 ^^

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: We have 14 minutes left until submission :D getting kinda stressed bc of rust

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Weird changing that did not change our fork digest

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Found and fixed it, we're now getting a bunch of "NonLinearParentRoot" errors

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> @xrchz and I are working on extending Ben Edgingtons c-kzg to include high-level functions that will do all the cryptography needed to implement 4844. The implementation work is actually pretty much done (thanks to excellent prior work by Ben), so we now need help to create the right interfaces for clients

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> If you are interested this please join https://t.me/+R677gbCrlVoyYTk0 for discussion

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> Current state of the work is here: https://github.com/dankrad/c-kzg/tree/lagrange_form

author: Deleted User
content: i was reading Vitalik's DAS/Sharding post (https://hackmd.io/@vbuterin/sharding_proposal#Why-not-just-use-DAS-and-not-committees) and it seems to me that the P2P layer would become extremely complex and potentially easier to disrupt. Is this the plan also for Danksharding?

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> yes. This is definitely one of our biggest concerns right now with full sharding and data availability sampling. we're doing very active research into building robust DAS solutions

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> Thinking about a leaner sampling network solution too, planning to present at devcon :)
